titleStmt.title: The true and last newes from Ireland. As it was delivered by a gentleman of great credit, who was himselfe and wife prisoners unto the rebels for the space of 13 weekes, neere unto the towne of Drogheda, in the north of that kingdome. Comtaining a true relation of the brave atchievements of the honourable, Francis Moore, brother to the right honourable Charles, Lord Moore, lord viscount of Drogheda. A true copy of the election of Lieutenant generall Plunquet, under the hand of Sir Phelom O-neile knight, generall of the Irish rebels.

The true and last newes from Ireland. As it was delivered by a gentleman of great credit, who was himselfe and wife prisoners unto the rebels for the space of 13 weekes, neere unto the towne of Drogheda, in the north of that kingdome. Comtaining a true relation of the brave atchievements of the honourable, Francis Moore, brother to the right honourable Charles, Lord Moore, lord viscount of Drogheda. A true copy of the election of Lieutenant generall Plunquet, under the hand of Sir Phelom O-neile knight, generall of the Irish rebels.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
